description: Average damage per second in melee combat.\n\nThis stat ignores target defenses like dodging and armor.
label: Melee DPS

description: A multiplier on the amount of melee damage inflicted by this person.
label: Melee Damage Factor

description: A multiplier on the time this creature takes to recover after making a melee attack.
label: Melee Cooldown

description: Average armor penetration of all attacks in melee combat.\n\nThis stat includes currently used weapon.
label: Melee Armor Penetration

description: Chance to hit a target in melee.\n\nThe target can still dodge even if we would've hit.
label: Melee Hit Chance

description: Chance to dodge a melee attack that would've otherwise hit.\n\nCharacters will not dodge while aiming or firing a ranged weapon.
label: Melee Dodge Chance

description: A multiplier on the cooldown between bursts when using a ranged weapon.
label: Ranged Cooldown Multiplier

description:
Base chance to not miss per cell of shot distance.

Chance to hit is also affected by many other factors.

A hit chance explanation for any shot can be seen by selecting a shooter and mousing over a target.
label: Shooting Accuracy

description: A multiplier on accuracy at a distance of 3 cells or less.
label: Accuracy Factor (Close)

description: A multiplier on accuracy at a distance of 12 cells.
label: Accuracy Factor (Short)

description: A multiplier on accuracy at a distance of 25 cells.
label: Accuracy Factor (Medium)

description: A multiplier on accuracy at a distance of 40 cells or more.
label: Accuracy Factor (Long)

description: How long it takes to shoot after choosing a target.
label: Aiming Time

description: A multiplier on the miss radius of a mortar used by this person. Smaller numbers means more accurate mortar shells.
label: Mortar Miss Radius Multiplier

description: Chance to spring a trap the character is unaware of.
label: Trap Spring Chance

description: A multiplier on all incoming damage.
label: Incoming Damage Multiplier

description: A multiplier on the duration of the stagger-slowdown that occurs when damage is taken.
label: Stagger Time Multiplier

description: Speed of movement in cells per second.
label: Move Speed

description: Speed of crawling in cells per second.
label: Crawl Speed

description: As long as someone's mood is below this level, they are in danger of having a mental break.\n\nThe severity of the mental break will depend on how far below the threshold they are.
label: Mental Break Threshold

description: More sensitive people suffer more from negative psychic effects, and benefit more from positive ones. Higher psychic sensitivity also increases neural heat limit.
label: Psychic Sensitivity

description: How well this creature resists toxic buildup.
label: Toxic Resistance

description: A multiplier on the learning rate for all skills.
label: Global Learning Factor

description: A multiplier on how quickly a creature rests while sleeping.
label: Rest Rate Multiplier

description: A multiplier on eating speed.
label: Eating Speed

description: Below this temperature, characters will be unhappy.\n\nSignificantly below this temperature, they will develop hypothermia and frostbite and eventually die.
label: Min Comfortable Temperature

description: Above this temperature, characters will be unhappy.\n\nSignificantly above this temperature, they will develop heatstroke and eventually die.
label: Max Comfortable Temperature

description: The speed at which this character gains immunity to diseases.\n\nIf this is too slow, the character will die from a disease before developing immunity.
label: Immunity Gain Speed

description: The multiplier applied to a person's injury healing rate.
label: Injury Healing Factor

description: The amount of stuff this creature can carry in its hands, mouth, or other manipulators.\n\nThis is separate from the ability to carry cargo on long cross-world trips.
label: Carrying Capacity

description: The amount of meat yielded when butchering this creature. This value is reduced if the creature is not slaughtered cleanly, or if it is wounded when killed.
label: Meat Amount

description: The amount of leather yielded when butchering this creature. This value is reduced if the creature is not slaughtered cleanly, or if it is wounded when killed.
label: Leather Amount

description: This creature cannot be tamed, trained, or commanded by anyone with less than this skill in animals.
label: Minimum Handling Skill

description: The pain level at which this creature is downed from pain.
label: Pain Shock Threshold

description: The amount of nutrition this person will automatically forage per day while traveling by caravan.
label: Foraged Food Amount

description: How much filth this creature produces.\n\nIt's best to keep filth-producing animals outdoors or on straw matting where their filth won't be a problem.
label: Filth Rate

description: A multiplier on the learning rate for animals skill.
label: Animals Learning Factor

description: The multiplier applied to a person's movement speed when they ride this animal as part of a caravan. Animals can only be ridden in caravans.
label: Caravan Riding Speed

description: The amount of nutrition needed to completely fill this creature's stomach.
label: Max Nutrition

description: Lifespan factor alters the effective lifespan of a creature by shortening or lengthening the time until they develop age-related diseases. A lifespan factor over 100% delays disease onset and increases overall lifespan, while a lifespan factor under 100% speeds up disease onset and reduces lifespan.
label: Lifespan Factor

description: The amount of psyfocus a person gains per day of meditation, ignoring bonuses from focus objects.
label: Meditation Psyfocus Gain

description: The maximum amount of neural heat individual can tolerate safely.
label: Neural Heat Limit

description: The rate at which this person reduces neural heat.
label: Neural Heat Recovery Rate

description: How resistant this creature is to the effects of environmental toxins. This protects against toxic fallout and rot stink exposure, but not against direct attacks with venom or injected poison.
label: Toxic Environment Resistance

description: A multiplier on the speed that a person's sleep need falls.
label: Sleep Fall Rate

description: This mechanoid has special shielding and shock-dissipation filaments that reduce the effect of EMP damage by this percentage. This reduces the duration of stuns caused by EMP.
label: EMP Resistance

description: A multiplier on the speed that a person's recreation need falls.
label: Recreation Fall Rate

description: How effective this person is as a negotiator.\n\nThis affects the speed of prisoner recruitment, impact on faction relations when giving gifts, and the outcome of peace talks.
label: Negotiation Ability

description: How physically attractive this person is. This affects social interactions.
label: Beauty

description: How effective this person is in arresting people. This affects chance that this person will be able to arrest someone without resistance.
label: Arrest Success Chance

description: When this person acts as a trade negotiator, buy and sell prices are improved by this percentage.
label: Trade Price Improvement

description: When this person sells non-medical drugs, prices are improved by this percentage.
label: Drug Sell Price Improvement

description: A multiplier on how much other people are affected by this person's social interactions.
label: Social Impact

description:
The base chance this person will successfully tame an animal on any given attempt.

The actual chance is also affected by the animal's wildness.
Failed tame attempt can induce animal attacks, especially for more vicious animals.
label: Tame Animal Chance

description: The base chance this person will make progress training an animal on a given attempt.\n\nThe actual chance for a given attempt will also depend on the animal's wildness, whether it is bonded with the trainer, and so on.
label: Train Animal Chance

description: A multiplier on the chance to bond with an animal when interacting with it.
label: Bond Chance Factor

description: A multiplier on a character's speed at doing any kind of work.
label: Global Work Speed

description: A speed at which this person mines away walls.
label: Mining Speed

description: A speed at which this person uses a deep drill to extract underground resources.
label: Deep Drilling Speed

description:
The percentage of mined resources a miner will produce.

This applies to both wall mining and deep drill mining.
This doesn't affect the production rate of rock chunks from deep drills.
label: Mining Yield

description: A multiplier on the speed at which this person smooths rough stone floors and walls.
label: Smoothing Speed

description: How fast this person performs research and how quickly they can find things using scanning equipment.
label: Research Speed

description: The speed at which this person milks, shears, and otherwise gathers resources from animals.
label: Animal Gather Speed

description: The percentage yield someone receives when they shear, milk, or otherwise gather resources from a living animal.\n\nHigher percentages reduce the chance of wasting the product.
label: Animal Gather Yield

description: The speed at which this person sows and harvests plants.
label: Plant Work Speed

description: The yield this person gets when harvesting plants.\n\nLow yields give a chance that this person will accidentally waste the harvest.
label: Plant Harvest Yield

description: The yield this person gets when harvesting drug crops.\n\nLow yields give a chance that this person will accidentally waste the harvest. High yields increase the yield from each plant.
label: Drug Crop Harvest Yield

description:
This stat reduces the chance of hunted animals attacking the hunter.

A 0% score means no reduction.
A 100% score means animals never attack.
label: Hunting Stealth

description: The speed at which this person constructs and repairs buildings.
label: Construction Speed

description: The chance that this person will succeed in constructing something.\nFailing means wasting time and resources.
label: Construct Success Chance

description:
The chance that this person will successfully repair a broken down building using a component.

Failing means wasting time and resources.
Note that this only applies to repairing breakdowns, which is different from repairing damage.
label: Repair Success Chance

description: A multiplier on how fast this cleans up filth from the ground.
label: Cleaning Speed Multiplier

description: A multiplier on how fast this person can read.
label: Reading Speed

description: Speed at which the character tends to wounds and illnesses.
label: Medical Tend Speed

description: The base quality of tending given when tending wounds and illnesses.\n\nThe actual tend quality will also be affected by factors like medicine used, facilities, luck, and so on.
label: Medical Tend Quality

description: The speed at which the character performs medical operations.
label: Medical Operation Speed

description:
The base chance that a character will succeed when performing a medical operation.

The actual success chance is also affected by factors like facilities, room cleanliness, medicine used, the difficulty of the surgery, and inspirations.

No matter how high this stat is, there is always a small chance of failure on any operation.
label: Medical Surgery Success Chance

description: The speed at which this person smelts things.\n\nSince smelting is dumb labor, smelting speed is not affected by any skill.
label: Smelting Speed

description: The speed at which this person carries out general labor like making stone blocks, making chemfuel at a refinery, burning items, tailoring clothes, creating art, smithing armor and weapons or smelting slag. This stat applies both to activities that involve no skill, as well as those where the skill affects the quality of the product instead of the speed of production.
label: General Labor Speed

description: How fast this character synthesizes complex chemical drugs.
label: Drug Synthesis Speed

description: The speed at which this person cooks meals.
label: Cooking Speed

description: The probability that this character will inadvertently poison a meal they cook.\n\nAnyone who eats a food-poisoned meal will be temporarily debilitated with pain, weakness, and vomiting.
label: Food Poison Chance

description: The speed at which this person brews beer and tea, or makes simple drug products like smokeleaf joints.
label: Drug Cooking Speed

description: The speed at which this person butchers flesh creatures.
label: Butchery Speed

description: The speed at which this person can shred a mechanoid for resources.
label: Mechanoid Shredding Speed

description: The amount of meat produced when butchering flesh creatures.\n\nThe actual amount is also related to the creature's size.
label: Butchery Efficiency

description: The amount of materials yielded when this person shreds a dead mechanoid for resources.\n\nThe actual amount is also related to the mechanoid's size.
label: Mechanoid Shredding Efficiency
